org.grouplens.lenskit.cursors

Class Cursors

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.lenskit.cursors.Cursors

  • public final class Cursors
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility methods for cursors.

    Compatibility: Public

      • wrap

        public static <T> Cursor<T> wrap(java.util.Iterator<? extends T> iterator)
        Wrap an iterator in a cursor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data to return.
        Parameters:
        iterator - An iterator to wrap
        Returns:
        A cursor returning the elements of the iterator.

      • wrap

        public static <T> Cursor<T> wrap(java.util.Collection<? extends T> collection)
        Wrap a collection in a cursor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data to return.
        Parameters:
        collection - A collection to wrap
        Returns:
        A cursor returning the elements of the collection.

      • filter

        public static <T> Cursor<T> filter(@WillCloseWhenClosed
                   Cursor<T> cursor,
                   Predicate<? super T> predicate)
        Filter a cursor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of cursor rows.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The source cursor.
        predicate - A predicate indicating which rows to return.
        Returns:
        A cursor returning all rows for which predicate returns true.

      • filter

        public static <T> Cursor<T> filter(@WillCloseWhenClosed
                   Cursor<?> cursor,
                   java.lang.Class<T> type)
        Filter a cursor to only contain elements of type type. Unlike filter(Cursor, Predicate) with a predicate from Predicates.instanceOf(Class), this method also transforms the cursor to be of the target type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value in the cursor.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The source cursor.
        type - The type to filter.
        Returns:
        A cursor returning all elements in cursor which are instances of type type.

      • transform

        public static <S,T> Cursor<T> transform(@WillCloseWhenClosed
                        Cursor<S> cursor,
                        Function<? super S,? extends T> function)
        Transform a cursor's values.
        Type Parameters:
        S - The type of source cursor rows
        T - The type of output cursor rows
        Parameters:
        cursor - The source cursor
        function - A function to apply to each row in the cursor.
        Returns:
        A new cursor iterating the results of function.

      • empty

        public static <T> Cursor<T> empty()
        Create an empty cursor.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value in the cursor.
        Returns:
        An empty cursor.

      • makeList

        public static <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> makeList(@WillClose
                                  Cursor<? extends T> cursor)
        Read a cursor into a list, closing when it is finished.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of item in the cursor.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The cursor.
        Returns:
        A new list containing the elements of the cursor. The list has been allocated with a capacity of Cursor.getRowCount() if possible, but has not been trimmed.

      • sort

        public static <T> Cursor<T> sort(@WillClose
                 Cursor<T> cursor,
                 java.util.Comparator<? super T> comp)
        Sort a cursor. This reads the original cursor into a list, sorts it, and returns a new cursor backed by the list (after closing the original cursor).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value in the cursor.
        Parameters:
        cursor - The cursor to sort.
        comp - The comparator to use to sort the cursor.
        Returns:
        A cursor iterating over the sorted results.

      • of

        public static <T> Cursor<T> of(T... contents)
        Create a cursor over a fixed set of elements. This is mostly useful for testing.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The data type.
        Parameters:
        contents - The contents.
        Returns:
        The cursor.

      • concat

        public static <T> Cursor<T> concat(java.lang.Iterable<? extends Cursor<? extends T>> cursors)
        Concatenate cursors. Each cursor is closed as closed as it is consumed.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of data.
        Parameters:
        cursors - The cursors to concatenate.
        Returns:
        The concatenated cursor.

      • concat

        public static <T> Cursor<T> concat(Cursor<? extends T>... cursors)
        Concatenate cursors.
        See Also:
        concat(Iterable)
